intro: Camellia euphlebia, commonly known as the white camellia, is a species native to southern China and northern Vietnam. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Theaceae family, characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, camellia-like flowers. The plant typically produces white or pale pink petals that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Camellia euphlebia is also valued for its hardiness and ability to withstand mild frosts.
